name: Art Exploration
description: Through this hands-on class, students will work independently and have opportunities to collaborate with others to make two-dimensional collages, drawings, and paintings and build three-dimensional structures inspired by parallels with natural/urban settings. The projects aim to empower students to participate in developing their creativity and engagement by using traditional art supplies like paint, markers, colored pencils, and an array of recycled materials, such as fabric scraps, cardboard,

howToGetIt: Register online at sfrecpark.org/register or call the registration hotline at (628) 652-2900
agency: Harvey Milk Center for the Arts
